content.webTitle: New Orleans chosen as 2013 Super Bowl host

fields.headline: New Orleans chosen as 2013 Super Bowl host
fields.bodyText: New Orleans will host the 2013 Super Bowl for the first time since Hurricane Katrina caused 1,600 deaths and devastated the area four years ago. NFL team owners voted for New Orleans on Tuesday ahead of Miami, which had sought a record 11th Super Bowl, and 2008 host Glendale, Arizona. It is the 10th time New Orleans has been named as venue for the Super Bowl. New Orleans last hosted the event in 2002, when Adam Viniatieri's 48-yard field goal as time expired helped New England to a dramatic win over St. Louis.
